name: 1,2-bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2983
Reason: 1,2-bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone has a basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The compound has two amino groups, which can form hydrogen bonds and increase the melting point by approximately +50°C each. The ketone group can also participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by around +20°C. The ethanone group also increases the molecular weight and rigidity, which can add another +10°C.
